required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Usability and Performance Evaluation of the AutoLap System - a Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: Usability and Performance Evaluation of the AutoLap System - a Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: The main objectives of this study are to evaluate the ease of use and performance of the AutoLap system compared to human camera holder during general and bariatric laparoscopic surgeries.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during surgery, an expected average of 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: measured by the vibrations of inertial sensors

primary_outcome.time_frame: post surgery, an expected average of 3 minutes
primary_outcome.description: The ease of use of the AutoLap system will be evaluated by a set of questionnaires

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during surgery, an expected average of 5 minutes
during surgery, an expected average of 1 hour

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of times that the laparoscope was removed for cleaning
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during surgery, an expected average of 1 hour

arm_group.description: Procedures will be performed with the AutoLpap system used for holding and controlling the movement of the laparoscope.
Procedures will be performed with the assistance of human camera holder.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Signed and dated Informed Consent Form (ICF).
2. Patients over 18 years who were scheduled for elective laparoscopic Cholecystectomy, Nissen fundoplication, paraesophageal hernia and sleeve surgery procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Extensive adhesions that will preclude routine laparoscopic surgical approach.
2. Pregnancy
3. Patient participates in any other clinical study 60 days prior to the start of the study and throughout the study duration.
